bwwExcerpt: At the end of the play, a broken Blanche, the woman who represents the Old South, utters one of the most self-evident lines in Williams’ repertoire: “I’m anxious to get out of here — this place is a trap.” She’s right but the production definitely isn’t — it’s a joy that reminds us again how good Williams was.

keyPhrases.quote: the production definitely isn't — it's a joy that reminds us again how good Williams was.
